conbody.p: partitioning By default, all the data files for a table are located in a single directory. Partitioning is a technique for physically dividing the data during loading, based on values from one or more columns, to speed up queries that test those columns. For example, with a school_records table partitioned on a year column, there is a separate data directory for each different year value, and all the data for that year is stored in a data file in that directory. A query that includes a WHERE condition such as YEAR=1966, YEAR IN (1989,1999), or YEAR BETWEEN 1984 AND 1989 can examine only the data files from the appropriate directory or directories, greatly reducing the amount of data to read and test.
